questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: M = 30 N east, N = 20 N south, P = 10 N east. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: East components sum to 40 N, south 20 N. Magnitude = √(40²+20²)=44.7 N, direction = tan⁻¹(20/40)=26.6° south of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: R = 70 N north, S = 40 N south, T = 40 N east. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net north = 30 N, east = 40 N. Magnitude = 50 N, direction = tan⁻¹(30/40)=36.9° north of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: A = 15 N west, B = 25 N north, C = 20 N east. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net east = 5 N, north = 25 N. Magnitude = √(5²+25²)=25.5 N, direction = tan⁻¹(25/5)=78.7° north of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: X = 50 N south, Y = 30 N east, Z = 40 N north. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net south = 10 N, east = 30 N. Magnitude = √(30²+10²)=31.6 N, direction = tan⁻¹(10/30)=18.4° south of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: F₁ = 10 N at 0° (east), F₂ = 20 N at 90° (north), F₃ = 15 N at 180° (west). What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net west = 5 N, north = 20 N. Magnitude = √(5²+20²)=20.6 N, direction = tan⁻¹(20/5)=75.9° north of west.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: U = 35 N at 45° north of east, V = 25 N at 90° north, W = 30 N west. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Components: U gives 24.75 N east, 24.75 N north; V adds 25 N north; W gives 30 N west. Net west = 5.25 N, net north = 49.75 N. Magnitude ≈ 50.0 N, direction ≈ 84.0° north of west.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: P = 60 N east, Q = 50 N south, R = 40 N west. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net east = 20 N, south = 50 N. Magnitude = √(20²+50²)=53.9 N, direction = tan⁻¹(50/20)=68.2° south of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: A = 20 N north, B = 30 N east, C = 25 N south. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net south = 5 N, east = 30 N. Magnitude = √(30²+5²)=30.4 N, direction = tan⁻¹(5/30)=9.5° south of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: M = 40 N west, N = 30 N south, O = 50 N north. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net north = 20 N, west = 40 N. Magnitude = √(40²+20²)=44.7 N, direction = tan⁻¹(20/40)=26.6° north of west.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: F₁ = 15 N east, F₂ = 25 N south, F₃ = 20 N north-east at 45°. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: F₃ components: east 14.14 N, north 14.14 N. Net east = 29.14 N, net south = 10.86 N. Magnitude = √(29.14²+10.86²)=31.1 N, direction = tan⁻¹(10.86/29.14)=20.4° south of east.

scoreMessages.70: Good work! Practice resolving vectors into components.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on combining perpendicular vectors.
scoreMessages.0: Review the head-to-tail method and Pythagorean theorem.
